definitions.definition: write the name and address of the intended recipient on (an envelope, letter, or package).
examples: I addressed my letter to him personally
synonyms: superscribe More"I addressed the envelope by hand"direct
remit "correspondence should be addressed to the Human Resources Department"

definitions.definition: speak to (a person or an assembly), typically in a formal way.
examples: she addressed an audience of the most important Shawnee chiefs
synonyms: collar "Rev. Lally addressed a crowded congregation"

definitions.definition: name someone in a specified way when talking or writing.
examples: she addressed my father as “Mr. Stevens.”
synonyms: designate; Morespeak to; formaldenominate "the question of how to address one's parents-in-law"

definitions.definition: say or write remarks or a protest to (someone).
examples: address your complaints to the Board of Review

definitions.definition: think about and begin to deal with (an issue or problem).
examples: a fundamental problem has still to be addressed
synonyms: devote oneself to "the selectmen failed to address the issue of subsidies"

definitions.definition: take up one's stance and prepare to hit (the ball).
